text:
Hi Aitor, we had the same problem this week. We solved it. It looks like the picture. What you need to do is take the name from the theme folder, in this case it is theme, and write it to your deploy.sh.

 npx hs upload theme (write your theme name here e.g. boiler plate)

I hope I could help

Hello!

Can I set a module field's id myself, or do I have to use the value given by HubSpot. Example in the screenshots for better context.

"id": "21fae4d5-1bd4-bf4c-f7fe-41194f1d7d61"

Can I change it too

"id": "accordian_body_copy"

Not speaking from experience, but google tells me  this:

This issue can arise due to incompatibility between SSL certificate file of npm and node registry.

Try

1) telling your current version of npm to use node's ca instead of built in ca

`npm config set ca=""`

2) OR upgrading your version of npm
`npm install npm -g --ca=null`

Hey <@U03669T3EH4>! You definitely can. If you’re already using this module on the site though, I’d be careful - haven’t tested it, but it might clear out the existing content for that field. I usually only do this when I’m developing a module for the first time (so I’m sure it’s not in use somewhere).
